description: Got in a nice and easy Sunday ride in a pretty empty Downtown St Louis. Aside from a light crowd around Busch Stadium for a long rain-delayed game, the city was a ghosttown. I got to ride around the Arch, watch some of the game from outside sitting on my bike, ride the warf, Union Station. Nice little ride.

location: Garden of the Gods - Colorado Springs CO
description: Awesome early morning ride. Old Colorado Springs. Manitou Springs. Garden of the Gods. I could ride around there all day. Highlight...I rode across a fun little bike resort. Might be a fun place for a future stay.
BUCKET LIST RIDE!!! I've been riding this route via a video on my Peleton for years. Today, I finally got to actually ride it and IT. WAS. AWESOME.
A festive 4th of July ride around a cool mountain resort town that incuded a little more climbing than I expected and ended with a drove show. I still prefer firewors, but it was a cool day.

location: Mah Dah Hey Trail - Medora ND
description: I've been wanting to ride Mah Dah Hey for a long time and it did not disappoint. I followed a trip I mapped at on Komoot. At want point, the map took me to what i thought would be a bridge a bridge across the Little Missouri River. When I got there...no bridge. It was close to dark and riding back the way I cam would have added about 10 miles, so I took off my boots, tied them around my neck and swam my bile across the river. Loved every minute of it.

Another bucket list ride in the bag. I want later in the day after a rain storm and the road was surprisingly quiet. The ride up was incredible. On the way back down, I stopped to take a picture of one of the tunnels. As I was putting my phone back on my bike, I saw a cougar peak it's head thru the tunnel. Ughhhh! I waited for a car to drive the tunnel before I built up the nerve to do it myself.

Souix Falls is one of my faovrite towns. There are great paths to ride and always tons to see. The falls are incredible and I'll ride there any chance I get. It reminds me a lot of Richmond bult around the James River.
I lived in Virginia Beach a couple summers in college and I always love going back. tons of great places to ride. It's changes soooo much since my day.

location: Upper Shirley Wine Ride - Richmond VA
